p.s: The movie had a huge impact on my life and perspective on racism.
This is because the film really showed and expressed the problems that people like Starr have and that they need to speak up for themselves, because noone else will.
It puts their life in perspective with our lifeslives and how different it is.

The given scene is a perfect example of that: While Chris can allow himself to do whatever he wants in school, Starr can't and has to hide herself, because she feels different from the others and not comfortable.
This scene also shows that Starr wouldn't be happy at that time if there wasn't Chris who ultimately made her smile.
We get to know so many problems, we never could have imagined and this movie perfectly expressed them.
For me, this movie completely changed my perspective on people like Starr.
Those people have gained my respect for still keeping up with all the issues around them.
This movie showed, that even if everything and everyone is against you, you can still fight against it.
Starr was a perfect example for such a problem and the movie The Hate U Give has put that in perspective to people who may never have thought racism has such a huge impact on peoplespeople's lives.
This is why I think that Angie Thomas wrote an exceptional book on a topic which obviously needs to be talked about and cannot be accepted, so that every child can have a normal life.
All in all, I really enjoyed watching the movie, because it covers the topic of racism in a teenage life very well and that you should stand up for yourself, even if everything is against you.
